personalInfo.family: Wife, Nancy Marilla; Craig (10/12/62), Ricky (10/27/64), Leslie (10/25/65)

tourBios.otherInfo: Lone official Champions Tour title came at the 1989 Southwestern Bell Classic when he defeated Orville Moody on the third hole of a playoff for the title in Oklahoma City...Broke into the winner's circle for the first time in 12 years at the unofficial 1986 Showdown Classic, joining forces with the PGA TOUR's Curt Byrum to shoot 39-under-par and triumph in Utah...Began playing the PGA TOUR in 1960 and recorded 11 PGA TOUR victories in his career...Biggest win came at the 1964 PGA Championship at Columbus (Ohio) CC, where he topped Jack Nicklaus and Arnold Palmer by three strokes. 72-hole total of 271 was a PGA Championship record until Nick Price broke it at Southern Hills in 1994...Also finished second to Gay Brewer at the 1967 Masters...Claimed the PGA TOUR's first $200,000 tournament, the Carling World Open at Oakland Hills CC in 1964...Also won the TOUR's first $300,000 event, the 1970 Dow Jones Open at Upper Montclair CC...Best year on the PGA TOUR was 1974, when he made $124,747 and placed 14th on the official money list...Member of the 1967 U.S. Ryder Cup team...Has had 12 holes-in-one in his professional career...Honored by the Golf Writers Association of America with the 1962 Ben Hogan Award for his amazing comeback from injuries sustained in a serious automobile accident in high school. Suffered a broken pelvis, concussion, back and internal injuries, was paralyzed from the waist down and unconscious for 13 days. Released from the hospital after 96 days and later regained the use of his legs, then subsequently discovered he still could play golf...Experienced another scary moment when he, Lee Trevino and Jerry Heard were struck by lightning at the 1975 Western Open...After winning junior golf titles in Kentucky, he met the legendary Bear Bryant, then coach of the University of Kentucky, who, after taking the helm at Texas A&M, offered him a football scholarship.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Champions was 1st in 1989 at the Southwestern Bell Classic.
